definition: tip (of pencil, spear etc)/sharp point/cutting edge/spearhead/vanguard
point of a spear/edge of a tool/vanguard/forward (in sports team)
awn (of cereals)/arista (of grain)/tip (of a blade)/Miscanthus sinensis (type of grass)/variant of 邙, Mt Mang at Luoyang in Henan
first sign of budding talent/to display one's ability for the first time
to draw in one's claws/to show some modesty

sentences.english: But developing-country banks now have got things right on a number of fronts.
sentences.chinese: 但是发展中国家银行已经开始初露锋芒。

sentences.english: Hard-edged body can use to describe the ecstasy.
sentences.chinese: 锋芒毕露的身体可以用来描述狂喜。

sentences.english: William worked in his father's shop until his talent for drawing became so obvious.
sentences.chinese: 威廉在父亲的小店帮忙直到他的绘画才能锋芒毕露。

sentences.english: Sloth turneth the edge of wit.
sentences.chinese: 懒散能磨去才智的锋芒。

sentences.english: The young man displayed his talent for the first time in the scientific and technological circles.
sentences.chinese: 那个青年人在科技界初露锋芒。

sentences.english: He uses it very often by concealing it, in fact.
sentences.chinese: 他实际上通过隐藏锋芒来运用学识。

sentences.english: No matter how successful he is, Mr. B still hides his light under a bushel.
sentences.chinese: 先生不管怎么成功，他总是不露锋芒，十分谦虚。

sentences.english: Sloth turneth the edge of wit.
sentences.chinese: 懒惰会磨去才智的锋芒。

sentences.english: You're clutching a light spear with a sharp, pointed stone at the end of it.
sentences.chinese: 你握紧手中轻盈的长矛，尖端上石制的矛尖锋芒毕露。

sentences.english: Golden Week holidays, the beginning of fire directed suburbs commercial real estate.
sentences.chinese: 十一黄金周期间，郊区商业地产开始初露锋芒。

sentences.english: There are a few specific ways that your network can help you to get some exposure through social media.
sentences.chinese: 在多个方面你的关系网会帮你在社会媒体上小露锋芒。

sentences.english: The Yangtse River howls power cutting edge.
Show-offs always come to no good.
sentences.chinese: 锋芒太刺眼的人往往没有好结果。

sentences.english: It pretty much obliterated all of medieval London ("the ancient lady") within the old Roman walls.
sentences.chinese: 中中世纪的伦敦早已被古老的罗马城墙的锋芒所掩盖。

sentences.english: The new clerk was a clever mathematician but was content to hide his light under a bushel.
sentences.chinese: 这个新职员是个聪明的数学家，但他喜欢不露锋芒。

sentences.english: But he was also a hard-edged office politician.
sentences.chinese: 不过，他也是一位锋芒毕露的办公室政治家。

definition: cutting edge or point of a knife, sword or tool
murderous spirit/aura of death/to vent one's anger
no stronghold one cannot overcome (idiom); to conquer every obstacle/nothing one can't do/to carry everything before one
to conceal one's strengths and bide one's time (idiom)/to hide one's light under a bushel
avoiding doing something that one is clumsy at to save face
